messages.original:
Zaporizhzhia City came under a combined KAB glide-bomb and Geran-2 drone attack last night. At least 7 Gerans impacted multiple targets within the city limits, while at least 6 KABs impacted the southern suburbs/outskirts. Widespread power outages are still ongoing, including in areas not usually affected as much. 
Additionally, long-range Smerch/Tornado-S MLRS targeted the city of Vil'nyans'k, northeast of Zaporizhzha City.

Zaporizhzhia City came under a combined KAB glide-bomb and Geran-2 drone attack last night. At least 7 Gerans impacted multiple targets within the city limits, while at least 6 KABs impacted the southern suburbs/outskirts. Widespread power outages are still ongoing, including in areas not usually affected as much. 
Additionally, long-range Smerch/Tornado-S MLRS targeted the city of Vil'nyans'k, northeast of Zaporizhzha City.
Several Russian Geran-2 drones targeted the Mekhanizatoriv Industrial Hub in Chernihiv City. NASA FIRMS data, as well as footage, shows that a large fire is now burning there.
Several Russian Geran-2 drones targeted the Mekhanizatoriv Industrial Hub in Chernihiv City. NASA FIRMS data, as well as footage, shows that a large fire is now burning there.

Zaporizhzhia City came under a combined KAB glide-bomb and Geran-2 drone attack last night. At least 7 Gerans impacted multiple targets within the city limits, while at least 6 KABs impacted the southern suburbs/outskirts. Widespread power outages are still‚Ä¶
One of the targets for the Gerans in Zaporizhzhia was the Motor Sich Plant, as evidenced by NASA FIRMS data.
One of the targets for the Gerans in Zaporizhzhia was the Motor Sich Plant, as evidenced by NASA FIRMS data.

Footage showing one of two Russian Geran-2 drone strikes on a Ukrainian passenger train in Shostka, Sumy Oblast, from yesterday.
The locomotive hit is No. ChME3 1816, and interestingly that same exact train was seen in September of this year covered in anti-drone netting. Additionally, the cargo cars can be linked back to Chornomorsk, Odesa Oblast, and that exact type has been used for maritime military purposes.

Footage showing one of two Russian Geran-2 drone strikes on a Ukrainian passenger train in Shostka, Sumy Oblast, from yesterday.
The locomotive hit is No. ChME3 1816, and interestingly that same exact train was seen in September of this year covered in anti-drone netting. Additionally, the cargo cars can be linked back to Chornomorsk, Odesa Oblast, and that exact type has been used for maritime military purposes.

Russian forces have recaptured the village of Vilne, Dobropillya direction, Donetsk Oblast.
Pre-war population: ~71.
Total land area: ~0.39 km¬≤.

Last night, Ukrainian missiles (likely Neptunes) targeted the Kliintsy Thermal Power Plant in Klintsy, Bryansk Oblast. Multiple impacts were recorded, and fires broke out at the plant, damaging the 110 kV switchgear field, and possibly the engine hall. 
Coordinates: 52.74925, 32.25512

Last night, Ukrainian missiles (likely Neptunes) targeted the Kliintsy Thermal Power Plant in Klintsy, Bryansk Oblast. Multiple impacts were recorded, and fires broke out at the plant, damaging the 110 kV switchgear field, and possibly the engine hall. 
Coordinates: 52.74925, 32.25512

Around 10 Ukrainian UAVs attacked the Feodosia Oil Depot in Crimea last night. Multiple drones impacted the fuel storage tanks, resulting in a massive fire breaking out, shrouding the city of Feodosia in smoke. 
This oil depot likely hasn't been operating due to significant damage from previous Ukrainian drone strikes. This attack probably targeted left-over fuel in the tanks. 
Feodosia Oil Depot is the largest oil loading terminal in Crimea. 
Coordinates: 45.06896, 35.39565

Around 10 Ukrainian UAVs attacked the Feodosia Oil Depot in Crimea last night. Multiple drones impacted the fuel storage tanks, resulting in a massive fire breaking out, shrouding the city of Feodosia in smoke. 
This oil depot likely hasn't been operating due to significant damage from previous Ukrainian drone strikes. This attack probably targeted left-over fuel in the tanks. 
Feodosia Oil Depot is the largest oil loading terminal in Crimea. 
Coordinates: 45.06896, 35.39565

Ukrainian UAVs attacked the Sverdlov Explosives Plant in Dzerzhinsk, Nizhny Novgorod Oblast, last night. At least two impacts were recorded to the plant's production facilities. 
The Sverdlov Explosives Plant specialises in the manufacturing of industrial explosives. It uses all existing methods of ammunition loading, meaning that explosives for ammunition for aviation, artillery shells, aviation bombs, ATGMs, engineering, anti-tank mines, air defence, and more, can all be produced here. 
Coordinates: 56.26944, 43.35444

Ukrainian UAVs attacked the Sverdlov Explosives Plant in Dzerzhinsk, Nizhny Novgorod Oblast, last night. At least two impacts were recorded to the plant's production facilities. 
The Sverdlov Explosives Plant specialises in the manufacturing of industrial explosives. It uses all existing methods of ammunition loading, meaning that explosives for ammunition for aviation, artillery shells, aviation bombs, ATGMs, engineering, anti-tank mines, air defence, and more, can all be produced here. 
Coordinates: 56.26944, 43.35444

Several Ukrainian HIMARS rockets struck the Luch Thermal Power Plant in Belgorod City last night. Strong explosions were heard and fires broke out. At least 40,000 people were left without power. 
Media 3 shows rockets being launched from within Kharkiv City. Trails from several other rockets are also visible in that video. 
The Luch TPP was previously hit and damaged by HIMARS GMLRS on September 28.

Media 3 shows rockets being launched from within Kharkiv City. Trails from several other rockets are also visible in that video.

While Kyiv Waits For NATO-Made ‚ÄúUkrainian‚Äù Flamingo Missiles, Russia Keeps Striking Hard At Ukraine‚Äôs Energy And Infrastructure
On the night of October 4-5, 2025, the Russian Armed Forces carried out one of the largest combined strikes against Ukraine's energy and military infrastructure. According to Russian sources, over 700 unmanned aerial vehicles of various types were launched, including "Geran-2," "Gerbera," and "Harpy," along with approximately 50 long-range cruise missiles‚Äî"Kh-101," "Kalibr," and the hypersonic "Kinzhal." Ukrainian sources confirm the scale of the attack, estimating the number of assets used at 496 drones and 53 missiles.
The strikes were carefully coordinated and aimed at disabling key elements of the energy grid across Ukraine. Particular focus was placed on the Lviv region in the west of the country, as well as the Chernihiv, Zaporizhzhia, and several other regions. Strategic thermal power plants, substations, and gas infrastructure facilities were hit...
üëâ

North Korea Showcases Pantsir-Like Air Defense System
North Korea has showcased a short-range air defense system with a design similar to that of Russia‚Äôs Pantsir on the sideline of the Defense Development-2025 exhibition in Pyongyang.
The Korean Central News Agency (KCNA) on October 5 shared a photo of the system from the exhibition, which was opened by North Korean leader Kim Jong Un.
‚ÄúWeapons systems are being developed or improved to respond effectively to changes in modern warfare, and the latest scientific advancements, including artificial intelligence technologies, are being actively introduced,‚Äù Kim said during the opening address.
üëâ

Hamas Reportedly Preparing To Disarm, Leave Gaza Amid Deadly Israeli Strikes (18+ Videos)
Arab media reports from October 5 suggest that Hamas is planning to fully comply with the peace plan presented by United States President Donald to the Israeli war on the Gaza Strip, including disarming and leaving the enclave.
Sources from Hamas told the Saudi-owned news channel Al-Hadath that the group‚Äôs fighters in Gaza have begun collecting the bodies of the dead hostages across the Strip, and that they had asked Israel to halt its aerial strikes so that they are able to complete the task.
At least 48 hostages remain in Gaza, with 22 believed alive and 26 confirmed dead, according to Israel. According to Al-Hadath , the transfer of the bodies will take some time, and there is flexibility from the U.S. on this matter.
üëâ

Battle Nears In Northern Syria With Drone Attacks On Kurdish Forces (Videos)
The Syrian Democratic Forces (SDF) accused the forces of Islamist-led Interim Government of targeting its fighters near the town of Tel Hafer, some 40 kilometers to the east of the northern city of Aleppo, with drones, in what it described as an attempt to ‚Äúdestabilize the security and stability‚Äù of its areas.
In a statement released late on October 5, the Kurdish-led group said that a drone launched by government forces hit a military vehicle in the outskirts of Deir Hafer, causing minor injuries to three fighters, and an Internal Security Forces patrol in the same area, wounding four more fighters.
Read more 
HERE
